website_summaries.verdict: Slices through 2x4 pieces of wood like butter, with alternate blades for rip and cross cutting. Its thin, flexible blade may challenge newer users.
pros: Easy to replace, and replacement blades are affordable
cons: Blade can’t be resharpened, but must be replaced
Does not work well for joinery due to flexible blade
Saw can drift a bit during a cut if pressure is exerted on the pull stroke due to thin kerf

customer_reviews.title: Best saw I ever had.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best saw I ever worked with, super clean and straights cuts. In the attached pictures I cut a 6x4 cedar wood like nothing. Very convenient the cross cut in one side and strip in the other when cutting tenons. If you plan work on something larger than 6x4 I recommend you to go for the larger one. The cross grain cut picture despite it looks like planed it is not, it is just right after cut, just incredible.
customer_reviews.author: rubcapgarTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Japanses "Pull" saw.
customer_reviews.text: My first Japanese pull saw, that cuts on the back stroke, not the forward stroke as we are accustomed to. Very thin "razor" blade with rip teeth on one side and crosscut on the other. This is a versatile saw and the long handle allows me to use both hands/arms once the blade is started into the wood. It produces a very fine cut edge and thin kerf. The face of the cut is remarkably smooth after a pass through the wood. It is a wonderful addition to my woodshop.
customer_reviews.author: shops2xs

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! After learning how to use the saw properly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! After learning how to use the saw properly, I am now able to make cuts as square as I can measure without having to drag out extension cords and whatnot required for electrical saws. It's great for cutting the little edge blocks off of tenons: crosscut down, flip the blade around, rip cut over and done. Cheap replacement blades are a real time saver. I will be buying more of these style saws as the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: Conquer Middle Earth
customer_reviews.text: Much larger than I expected. I dare say it is really fun to use. Samurai sword style handle and a spatula-like blade that has gone through the hardwood planks I've needed to cut with ease. It does not have a "high-end" feel to it, but has performed solid. At the price I think it's a fair deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Generic Dude

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a woodworking master by any means but this saw is great for quick and accurate cuts. This is my first Japanese saw and I already prefer it over American saws. It is especially useful when close tight quarters cuts are needed. Saw quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw, sharp blade
customer_reviews.text: This is a two-sided Japanese style "pull" saw, with a crosscut pattern on one side and a rip pattern on the other. The theoretical advantage of Japanese "pull" saws is that, since you are "pulling" the blade to cut, the saw doesn't have to be made as thick as a western "push" saw in order to resist being bent while in use. That means the wood cut (kerf) is narrower so there is less resistance to cutting, and the cut is more accurate. I ripped an 8-foot piece of lumber with less trouble and effort than a traditional western saw. Amazing product. Fair warning: You can't sharpen Japanese blades, you can only replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted to try one of these for ages. I broke down and made this purchase. Takes a minute to teach yourself not to use it like an American saw but well worth the learning curve. I recently used this on a small reno project for a friend. Was perfect for cutting through a small area of framing on the floor for a new doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse in the house

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful inexpensive saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw! Especially due to the price. I don't use it for rip cuts all that much, but on crosscuts it is a dream. Fast cutting and very clean. My only complaint is that the cuts are not as clean as say, a high end dovetail saw, but it is half to 1/3 the price so no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Errol K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw.  Sharp ... watch your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: So, let me just say ... OUCH! This thing is sharp ... razor sharp. They ain't lying! I've got two nice slices in my fingers to testify (my fault, I lost concentration at just the wrong time). There was a learning curve for me (I'm still not happy with my performance, but the saw is fine) compared to western push saws. Once you get used to it, pulling is nice in that you aren't worried about blade flex on the cut stroke. This saw cuts through wood like butter. There's a definite difference in the performance of the crosscut and rip cut blades.
customer_reviews.author: IAmAnAmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Make the Change and Don't Look Back
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw. High quality and well balanced. I had a lower quality Shark pull saw for many years and found I was using it more and more, and my Wester-style push saws just stayed on the pegboard. So I took the plunge and decided to upgrade from the Shark to a better quality saw at a reasonable price. With the Ryoba it's super easy to make smooth, accurate cuts, and I find I do it in 1/2 the time. This weekend woodworker is never going back.
customer_reviews.author: mburzins

customer_reviews.title: Hate giving a review on something like this
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the saw and have never ever had so much use for any other saw I've ever owned. Nonetheless, it's my first Japanese-type saw, so I have nothing to compare it to. Takes a little getting used to, but, frankly, for how often most people use manual saws nowadays, every time you pick one up it takes a little getting used to no matter what type you own. Used it for cutting 2x6's with fairly little effort during times when the noise of my circular was not okay. Great purchase and one I think I'll be using a lot in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J Towson

customer_reviews.title: Best saw ever
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the saw I have ever owned. I am so impressed with the Japanese style of carpentry and their tools. Ill be replacing everything I have with Japanese style tools. The double grit on this saw is great and I have never seen a saw eat wood as fast, as clean and crisp and this saw does. The pull action cut is far superior to the traditional push cut. So much precision. Dont be fooled by the thin blade, it cuts tremendously well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a nice saw. I used this to cut laminate flooring and it cut it without the typical tearing you get with regular hand saws. So glad I found this saw. It is easy to use and doesn't take as much pressure as regular saws. The action is smooth and the length of the handle is actually a good thing. There also was less dust created when I cut so I could still see my cut line and make a clean straight cut.
customer_reviews.author: k gannon

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have considered buying Japanese style saws for years. Bought this one and love it. Cuts quickly and accurately. I do picture framing and rather than cut the moulding to initial rough size on my table saw I now use the Ryoba. Also I often buy long pieces of lumber and have a car so bringing them home was often an adventure. On my last lumber buying trip I brought this saw and quickly sawed the pieces to the rough sizes I needed that would easily fit in my car. I will be buying other Japanese saws.
customer_reviews.author: A reader from upstate NY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw for multiple types of use!
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say, I do not do woodworking or renovation type work on a regular basis. That being said, I do occasionally build things and work on things at my home and this saw is priceless! I have used it to build everything from 8 Ft shelving in my building to very precisely cutting out a piece of drywall for a patch. If you like to tinker like I do and have a need for a good hand saw, I can’t think of a better investment than this one!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: New favorite tool!  didn’t realize how much easier a pull saw is!
customer_reviews.text: Huge difference from saws I grew up with. ! love the very small footprint/kerf this saw makes. its so precise when used correctly that ive even been doing a lot of my detail work easily by hand and cleaning up cuts from power tools with this saw because it is so efficient and sharp. Not sure when I’m supposed to replace blade, but Im ordering a backup blade so I don’t have to be in workshop without my new favorite tool!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Gal

customer_reviews.title: The 5-star reviews are true!
customer_reviews.text: This saw gives me a really nice finish and has made this new woodworker far more accurate than I had a right to be just starting out. I could remember many years ago using traditional "western" saws and not being able to cut a straight line for the life of me. Using this saw has given me the confidence to use other saws, curiously enough. Each saw has their purpose, strength and weakness. You really can't go wrong with this saw!
customer_reviews.author: MAINEiac

customer_reviews.title: Singing Saw
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Still new to Nipponese saws so it's always hard to remember the cut is on the pull. Was making a wooden fire starter and need to cut a chunk out of a branch I was working on. Was using a carving knife but then I remembered I picked this up and was like why the heck not. Cut melted through the wood. It did tend to wander(drift) a bit on the cut, but I'm sure with more experience that will go away. Added bonus it sings nicely when you slap it. Good ring to it.
customer_reviews.author: T.t

customer_reviews.title: I freakin' love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I freakin' love this saw. One saw does all. Eats up wood, thin kerf for a fine cut. Flush cuts and tenons. I love it. I used it to make all my cuts on two timber frame sawhorses for which I used 6x6 Doug Fir. Ideally, I'd have bought the longer version for that, as I could barely open my hands when I was done from all the sawing. But it worked flawlessly, and I don't plan on using it for something that large again, so this length is fine for me. I also used it to flush cut about 30 Kreg screw plugs and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: John Cocktoeson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hand saw
customer_reviews.text: Great for both ripping and standard cuts(the two sides). The long handle gives the ability to apply more pressure when cutting larger lumber for big projects. The pull motion seems to lend more control compared to western-style push saws. Basically you cannot get more out of a hand saw than what this Japanese tool provides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wonderful. Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly what I expected. Its longevity is yet to be determined, and my ability to transfer my occidental push stroke sawing into oriental pull stroke sawing is still, also, to be determined. Saw is incredibly sharp and the ability to cut flush is one of the keys to my buying the saw. A crosscut and rip cut blade on one saw, wonderful. Be careful, it will cut you, I have proof.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Forwood

customer_reviews.title: Other than AMAZON shipping issue.. its perfect 👌
customer_reviews.text: Other than AMAZON shipping this item with absolutely NO PROTECTION just thrown in a box and BENT because of this. I managed to be able to bend it back in shape and it works great so far. I am pretty surprised how fast this cuts!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin w.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing saw
customer_reviews.text: I love the Japanese style saw. I do a lot of hardwood woodworking and personally I tend to cut straighter with a pull style saw like this one than with a traditional saw. Also the Japanese style saw has a thinner kerf(blade width) than western style saws which help with accuracy. This particular saw comes highly regarded from many YouTube wood working channels and I must say they aren’t wrong. I have an Irwin brand that doesn’t compare.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This is now my go to saw. Pull saws are my future and recommend everyone to at least try them. This size is for anything up to a 5x5 I would think. Makes staying on line a breeze but also cuts faster then any push saw I've used. And did I mention the zero fatigue! Gyokucho is the best brand of saws I've ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Best handsaw I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Best handsaw I've ever used. This saw will cut wood in half the time of my other cheap hardware store saws. I used this to cut wood floor peices to size while installing hardware floors. I was unable to use my chopsaw because of furniture and noise and this worked perfectly and didn't even take much more time. The cuts can actually look better if done right also. I would recommend this saw to anyone who needs a handsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M

customer_reviews.title: Its a niche product for me, but its VERY good in its niche
customer_reviews.text: I dont get to use it often, but when I do, its so much fun. Its VERY sharp and does exactly what it needs to do. I use it mostly for flush trims and its great. It seems a little pricey for what it is, but its also VERY good at what it does so I quickly forgot about the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Thanks to all the other reviewers! This was perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to make a "chest on chest" because my stairway is too tight in one corner to get an actual chest on chest upsatairs. Got two simple chests of drawers on legs. Just had to cut four of the legs off while the chest was already assembled and make clean straight cuts so that it wouldn't look like some ridiculous "project". The result was absolutely perfect and looks like it was made that way.
customer_reviews.author: AHK

customer_reviews.title: Night and Day
customer_reviews.text: So I am new to woodworking but catching on quickly. I created a closet with adjustable shelving system for my daughter that is on the way. I used the kreg system for joining the plywood together, anyway I had some exposed pocket holes that I used to and needed a flush cut. I tried my porter-cable oscillation multi-tool, the first pocket hole I damaged the plywood, so purchased this saw. Wow, night and day. I see the light. great, sharp flush cutting saw.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Castillo

customer_reviews.title: A+...Great service, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Though I've been using a Dozuki for years, I wanted a pull saw to cut thicker material, so I ordered this Ryoba from Sakura Osaka. I was pleasantly surprised when it arrived over a week before the estimated delivery date. I've only used the saw once and it cut through 8/4 ash like it was pine.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: A good pull saw for cuting larger pieces of wood
customer_reviews.text: It's overkill for most of my needs--it's meant to cut moderately large pieces of wood, like 2x4s and planks--but it can still make good cuts in smaller pieces. It does take practice to get used to a pull saw, and the thinness of the blade can make it fragile, but the results are worth it. The cuts are smooth and clean, and the blade cuts quickly with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: The secret is to pull down with both hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw because I'm slowly moving away from power tools and want to resaw some boards by hand. After trying it out for just a few minutes, I've found it's faster and more accurate than my expensive rip and crosscut saws, which are now going up for sale. Not sure if Amazon sells replacement blades, but they can be found at Japan Woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: beancounter

customer_reviews.title: Great pull saw! Perfect for first timers.
customer_reviews.text: Has a quality feel to it, and the saw is extremely sharp. Arrived with a soft plastic cover, and only one blade protector. Its 100% accurate, what you see online is exactly what you get. It shipped really fast and arrived perfectley in a large cardboard box. I would recommend practicing quite a lot before actually performing any important jobs, because it take a while to get the hang of it. Nevertheless, I'm excited to get some work done with this beauty!
customer_reviews.author: idan nissan

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of other Japanese pull saws and this is probably the sharpest, though they all cut well. I bought this one for use with a miter box since it's flat without a brace and can make deeper 45 degree cuts without getting hung up. After using the Japanese style pull saws, I can't imagine ever using anything else for woodworking. They are simply a pleasure to use. This one is one of the best and I highly recommend it..
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: If I only had one hand saw it’s this one
customer_reviews.text: Stupid sharp and ready to use. I have been converted to the Japanese saws! I have several and this one is my favorite or at least my go to saw... Very versatile saw and leaves a clean cut I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: Good saw. This is for softwoods
customer_reviews.text: Good saw. This is for softwoods. Not recommended for hardwoods. If you do a lot of hardwoods they make another model of this saw with smaller tighter teeth so they don't warp or twist with use. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E. Funk III

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness Ryoba saw
customer_reviews.text: I have been a woodworker for 30yrs I have only used a cheap Japanese saw some years ago, Let me tell you This saw is Amazing**** I cannot wait too purchase the other Japanese saw with the stifener for cutting dovetails. This saw is Super sharp I tried cutting through several types of hard wood it cut like a hot knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive pull saw.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to cut dovetails and aren’t ready to lay out the money for a fancy saw, this is the saw for you. It has a thin kerf and a leaves a smooth finish. The handle is wooden with cane wrapping. It cuts quickly and efficiently once you learn how to hold the saw without tiring your arm. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C Mikles

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This saw is phenomenal, easy to work with and very thin kerf. Becoming one of my favorite saws! Bends a little on the push be careful not to damage it take your time let the saw work for you and your golden
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing saw Amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Really great hand saw. I mostly use it to flush cut dowels or any other wood that I feel needs a small cut. I compared this to some other saw brands you would normally buy from the hardware store and trust me, its really sharp. Definitely a great purchase for the price. Thank you for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ellis

customer_reviews.title: with the right amount of skill though it will go thru softwood like butter.
customer_reviews.text: Since I have worked with this type of saw before, I wanted to buy one, the craftmanship of this saw is Standard to others of its type and a fair Price. Its a must have for the skilled craftsman. what is to note with this type of saw (for those unfamilliar with a push saw) is that the blade is thin (making it able to produce the Quality of cuts it does) and prone to knicking, the trick is in the Motion and soft pressure, not strength, so when cutting, take your time at first and get used to the way this saw cuts, with the right amount of skill though it will go thru softwood like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Dkb

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect saw that makes clean cuts. I use this saw a lot to make cross cuts mostly on real wood (don't use it on plywood). To me is a lot easier to grab my Japanese saw to cut a piece wood than it is to setup the circular saw. My pull saw produces less noise, less saw dust and it is extremely easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan_U

customer_reviews.title: Hype is justified
customer_reviews.text: The hype around this wood is justified. Great straight cuts into walnut for some carving work I am doing. Such an awesome deal for the price. Not something I would use for camping, but definitely a great and cheap tool to keep in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: JDR

customer_reviews.title: Very fine
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent combo crosscut/rip pullsaw. The diamond teeth go through white oak like it's pine. The saw is as thin as a shaving razor, so the kerf is negligible. It cuts so straight and clean! It's everything a Japanese saw is meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: old enough to know

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Love
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for custom table builders. Cuts close and in tight places. Easy to use. It looks flimsy and cheaply constructed, but works like a charm. Can become a go to tool for some.
customer_reviews.author: Ricks Farm Art and Sawmilling

customer_reviews.title: I am sold on these Japanese tools!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do not consider myself an expert woodworker. Bought this just to try it because I've heard great things about it. Well, now I can't stop using it. I look for things to cut just because it makes it so easy. I refinished my deck and had to replace some 2x8 joists and cutting them square and straight with this saw was incredibly easy. Love it. For the price it's a no brainier.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think I would use this much.....wrong was I. This product is one of the best things in my workshop. Very very very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 90 % good
customer_reviews.text: blade is right on and sharp as it should be. be nice if it came with a cloth or bamboo handle wrap...it plasti so not real authentic ! also only had one side with a blade protector...needs two, already nicked myself when transporting
customer_reviews.author: CF&M

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I've been struggling with a hacksaw for all these years!
customer_reviews.text: First time I use it, I get a straighter cut than my best hacksaw cuts. It's so easy to use, doesn't bind up, and every cut is as straight as you want it to be. Right tool for the right job, I suppose!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Eck

customer_reviews.title: Goes through wood like the proverbial hot knife
customer_reviews.text: Goes through wood like the proverbial hot knife. Really like this saw with both crosscut and rip cut teeth on one saw. Cannot beat the price and if at some point it gets dull buy a new blade. Takes some getting use to it as its different than a western saw, but really liking it and will probably buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Green

customer_reviews.title: No regret get one!
customer_reviews.text: Gyokucho saw is amazing Japanese saw. I was so happy to get one. When I put saw blade on piece of wood, saw tooth catch the wood piece like magnet. I bought it for my shop, and I will get another one soon for home use.
customer_reviews.author: yasacop

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. I love it. In some 30 plus years in woodworking I never knew how wonderful these Japanese saws are. They cut on the pull so blades can be thinner and more flexible and the pull stroke pulls the saw blade straight. Just amazing.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopperDavidTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: very nice saw for quality cuts
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of wood work and crafts around the house. This is a great addition to my tools. It is extremely good at making fine cuts. Great value for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: viperamd64

customer_reviews.title: Losing teeth like a meth addict
customer_reviews.text: Some teeth broke off not long after I started using this saw. I like the feel of a Japanese saw and on some projects it's the way to go. I'll be looking for replacement blades soon since the missing teeth are causing it to stick while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for delicate cuts
customer_reviews.text: I really like this saw, I build tables and use this saw for small trim work. Works perfectly and provides a cut that needs very little sanding. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: What a great saw.
customer_reviews.text: My first Japanese saw. Great saw, very accurate! I’m cutting rough cedar right now and I know it’s soft wood, but this saw cuts with ease, and it becomes fun.
customer_reviews.author: The WHITE ALBUM

customer_reviews.title: Talk about sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best and only saw you need short of jigsaw work. Important note: it is a PULL saw. This gives you much more control over your cut depth. And there's no need to force it! Such a thin curf it drops through wood like butter. Don't worry about sharpening, just replace the blade.
customer_reviews.author: clint W.

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY BLEW ME AWAY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After seeing Japanese pull saws mentioned in several YouTube videos I decided to see what the hype was about. I started by picking up Dewalts version and was fairly impressed so after that I decided to try the real deal. And after using this saw for almost a month I can confidently say it's the best hand saw I've ever owned.I'll never go back top European style push saws I've never made cuts so silky smooth as I do with the gyokucho I'll be ordering several more if there saws very soon they're absolutely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: I use the crosscut more than the rip even on rip cuts. The crosscut is smother and the rip side jumps while pulling causing it to chatter.
customer_reviews.author: Patricio SFO

customer_reviews.title: Best saw I have used
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a saw like this before. I used it to cut corners off some 5/8" plywood for a minor project. Honestly, the corners I cut looked like the factory edges or a little better. It is amazing. I've used saws and other hand tools most of my life and this saw is the best woodworking saw I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. This has been a dream to work with, especially for this novice woodworker. Used to cut mortise/tenons in 1inch oak and 2 inch poplar. Nice clean cuts and very sharp blade, both edges. I would definitely purchase again. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cee

customer_reviews.title: Better than I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw, it does exactly what you expect. It can cut through hardwoods with very little effort and has a very small kerf. I really love that it cuts on the pull. I really wonder why western saws haven't all adapted to this paradigm.
customer_reviews.author: metasynergy

customer_reviews.title: Clean cut and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp as can be and very easy to use. I would say get this bad boy for your shop or even around the house if you are feeling adventurous. Clean cut lines and just let the saw do the work. As a wood worker I would highly suggest that you grab yourself one of these.
customer_reviews.author: S. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Saw it and bought it
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent saw and cuts fast but not highly accurate for fine work. The blade is a little thicker than I expected but it does still work for most cuts.
customer_reviews.author: D. Trelford

customer_reviews.title: Flush cutter
customer_reviews.text: I've really grown to like this saw, it's so easy to make a flush cut. Saws through hardwood just as fast as soft wood, maybe faster. Nice to get out a hand tool and quickly and quietly make s cut. Won't be without one now.
customer_reviews.author: F. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: This saw Cuts !
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw. The crosscut is fine and effortless. The rip, rougher and faster as it should be. I ordered this on 28th June and it arrived in the UK 7 days later posted from Japan ! I didn't expect it for another couple of weeks, so I was a very happy camper. For the price, this is one really good saw and I would highly recommend it. The kerf is 0.6mm. I also have a GYOKUCHO 372 DOZUKI 240MM and the kerf on that is only 0.3mm.
customer_reviews.author: G. J. Nicol

customer_reviews.title: incredible flush saw - love this product
customer_reviews.text: this is incredibly sharp, accurate, versatile, strong, and very easy to use. long handle allows for versatile use. two serrated edges offer fine, and less fine cuts for any project
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hull

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! I feel like an idiot for spending ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! I feel like an idiot for spending so much money on all my Veritas saws when I could have been buying these for much less and getting better results. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Rayo

customer_reviews.title: Wood Eater!!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best lumber saw I've ever used. It ate through a 2x6 in about 20 seconds with barely any effort. I can't wait to use it again. How did I ever live without one of these! It requires so little effort that I almost bent the blade on my first try because I pushed too hard.
customer_reviews.author: PeteD77

customer_reviews.title: First Saw, Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This saw is sharp, cuts neatly, is easy to use, and nicely hangs on my tool wall. I'm not an expert in saws, but as far as I can tell, it hits all the marks. This saw was bought as an entry level tool. The fact that it provides a crosscut and ripping saw made it inexpensive and convenient. I have no complaints, but I have used it quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: K. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Chop chop, saw saw
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly, nice and sharp! I bought this after seeing in used in a youtube vid. I have other saws for miter work, but this is a great addition. So far, I"m VERY impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mardis

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Haven't worked before with this type of hand saw. Now many cuts I usually used to do by power tools, I do by hand - very precise tool must have.
customer_reviews.author: Ivelin

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For All Woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: If you are a woodworker, this is a must have! So much better than the standard American Saw! I dont know why I waited so long to purchase one!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Krause

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile, effective saw. I was a little skeptical of how thin the blade was, but you can actually do some very precise cutting with it. Unless I need to cut metal with a hacksaw I always use this now if a manual saw is needed.
customer_reviews.author: BKH

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: I had a project requiring flush cutting the day I received the saw. This saw did the job beyond my expectation. I have used it on a few other smaller jobs and I wish I had know about this saw earlier. Great saw!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my woodworking son and he loves it. He says it is very sharp and quite easy to use. Apparently, it makes a long job short! As long as he's happy! It cost less on Amazon than at the Woodworking Shop, too! That makes me happy!
customer_reviews.author: megaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, clean straight cuts every time
customer_reviews.text: this saw is amazing. i've been cutting large joinery with this. I cut a few 10" logs and made some very large dovetails (8"x10"x3")on a bench using this and it worked great. clean cuts that required basically no finish work. the kerf is very small, and it tracks perfectly. Great saw
customer_reviews.author: RobM

customer_reviews.title: Does Japanese pull saw has a very good design for the beginner and has a rough side ...
customer_reviews.text: Does Japanese pull saw has a very good design for the beginner and has a rough side and they fine side. Able to cut Hardwoods with little to no tear-out. Also is able to swivel to cut on different angles.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wackerle

customer_reviews.title: Best saw ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best saw I have used period. Makes it so much easier to cut down a tree and hack it into smaller pieces to put in the green waste.
customer_reviews.author: LynneBW

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy saw.
customer_reviews.text: Both the blade and handle on the saw are cheap and flimsy. Blade was bent when it arrived. Might be worth $15, way overpriced People claiming this is a good saw have never used a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace S.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp little saw
customer_reviews.text: Use this to do small cutting jobs when the site calls for it. It’s small, light, and cuts fast.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Loup

customer_reviews.title: Durable, High Quality, Saw!
customer_reviews.text: The saw does a great job cutting straight lines easily. The quality is great, have accomplished 100+ cuts, and easy to store on a shelf or wall as it's thin. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: AndrewBuyReview

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Samurai Carpenter!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas but had to give it to him early to keep him from buying one for himself. Anyway, he loves it. Found it on Samurai Carpenter site.
customer_reviews.author: orcadeb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw! I'm somewhat new to hand saws and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw! I'm somewhat new to hand saws and I feel like these are easier to control than the traditional "english" saws which cut on the push stroke as opposed to the pull stroke with this saw. Great hand saw for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Willheis

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful little saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little saw. Take your time and every stroke can count. I've used it, so far, for both crosscutting and ripping red oak, white oak, maple, pine, ash and elm. It leaves a very fine surface.
customer_reviews.author: grouch

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully sharp and well made
customer_reviews.text: These are such a joy to use. With a bit of care, you'll have no problems making just the right cut, and pulling a saw makes nothing but sense.
customer_reviews.author: nibbles

customer_reviews.title: Buy this saw and never look back!
customer_reviews.text: Watch the samurai carpenter on youtube. He is the only reason I bought this saw and I do not regret it for a second. Get inspired people! This saw is so smooth and easy to use that today I rip cut a 2 foot long, 3 inch thick piece of maple. I own a table saw. it's just that good.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Snowden

customer_reviews.title: It's sharp
customer_reviews.text: It's the first hand saw that I actually enjoy using. It's very sharp and very good quality. It's super easy to get straight cuts and there is no problems with getting jammed in the cut like a Western saw.
customer_reviews.author: GenezZards

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I'm moving to this Japanese hand saw after using an American Shark saw for a while...What a worthy choice! The cut thickness of this saw is incredibly thin. The blade is extremely sharp. The handle is long and makes cutting straight and even much easier. Only thing I'd change is a longer blade. It's definitely designed for rough cutting boards to length or ripping boards to AK estimate width. Does not work with with most fine joinery work. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it and the flexibility it has. Super sharp as my thumb can attest to. Great for cutting trim flush and making precise cuts. It's my go to saw even with cuts that I could easily use a power tool for.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: This saw is very nice. It is my first pull saw and I ...
customer_reviews.text: This saw is very nice. It is my first pull saw and I prefer it over an american style push saw.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Doe

customer_reviews.title: lol this thing is great, i had my reservations but after using it ...
customer_reviews.text: believe the hype! lol this thing is great, i had my reservations but after using it i love it. there is a slight learning curve but it cuts very straight and clean and easy. definitely with the 30 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably awesome
customer_reviews.text: Cuts fast and straight... really straight, even if you're really inexperienced with handsaws like I am. Suddenly, I can make long, straight cuts, quickly. Which means I can actually do some decent woodworking techniques now!
customer_reviews.author: Wynne Pirini

customer_reviews.title: wood saw, Japaneses
customer_reviews.text: Ive used it, and it is very sharp and a good tool to have in my shop
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Carr

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: It is a awesome saw. I bought a cheap saw at HD some years ago, so I was not expecting too much out of cheap saw...I was wrong. This is great for weekend DIY. cuts like a butter.
customer_reviews.author: beat counter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easier to accurately cut than traditional push saw. Not difficult to get used to. Did exactly what I needed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: slices through wood with little effort like it were butter
customer_reviews.text: slices through wood with little effort like it were butter. one of my favorite tools. I routinely opt to use it instead of an electrical saw.
customer_reviews.author: Just Cav

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Been a woodworker for a while, never got the hang of a push saw, but this! I can actually cut straight lines without power tools! Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M.

customer_reviews.title: I like this saw very much
customer_reviews.text: I like this saw very much. I’m doing some very fine work that’s difficult to do properly with power equipment. I find it takes technique and care. But if I use care and presision it is a great saw. Oh yes and watch your fingers it is very sharp. It can wander if you don’t pay close attention. It’s all in your technique. It’s fast and easy if used correctly. Great saw. If you are new to this type of saw I recommend practice first before a critical cut.
customer_reviews.author: aebike

customer_reviews.title: RIP cuts the saw I recieved drifts left, every cut.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I cant give 5 stars is on rip cuts this saw drifts to my left. I know there is always operator error to consider, I have tried different wood types, different holds, different stances. Every rip cut the saw drifts within a few pulls. On cross cuts the saw performs wonderfully. These are incredibly light and fast cutting saws.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Joseph Molitor

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.text: At age 72 and never been much good at wood working, I find this saw the first thing ever to cut (especially rip) a piece of timber without having to rest every few seconds. It honestly makes cutting any piece of timber a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Van Zyl

product_meta.title: Ryoba 9-1/2inch Double Edge Razor Saw for Hardwoods from Japan Woodworker 1.7mm Teeth Pitch
product_meta.description: This high quality Japanese pull saw from Gyokucho does it all with less effort that a traditional western style saw. One side for ripping, the other for crosscutting, now you only need one saw for all general woodworking tasks. The 0.5mm thick, 9.4 inch long blade provides accurate cuts with much less effort.
feature_bullets: Impulse hardened teeth for extended wear
Accurately cuts a wide variety of joints
Modern variation of the traditional Japanese pull-stroke saw

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars717 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
